law.catch_line: Report on expiration of permit -- Contents.
law.text: Within sixty (60) days after the date of expiration of a permit, the permittee shall file with the cabinet a report stating the exact number of acres of land affected by the operation, the extent of the reclamation already accomplished by him, and such other information as may be required by the rules and regulations of the cabinet. The report shall be accompanied by a copy of the map filed with the original application which shall show any revisions made necessary by results of the operation.
law.history: Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 429, sec. 16, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1966 Ky. Acts ch. 4, sec. 18. -- Amended 1964 Ky. Acts ch. 61, sec. 6. -- Amended 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 105, sec. 9. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 8, sec. 12.
